pull.title: Increase default dbcache to 100 MiB
pull.body: 25 MiB is really silly small compared to the rest of the memory requirements, and slows down initial sync.

events.body: With Armory it reduces DB scan / load times significantly. From an hour or 2 to around 15-20 minutes or so on Windoze. (to be fair .. I use 2000MB instead of 25MB or even 100MB) .. it also seems to speed up initial load times a lot.
Could this become a startup option/config file option?
dbcache=100 in your bitcoin.conf will achieve this.

@sipa You need to take care of the GUI defaults also...

@drak Also with 0.9 that option was added to the GUI options.

ACK on the default change.

@Diapolo It's more helpful to point at the line that needs to be updated:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/qt/optionsmodel.cpp#L87

It may make sense to define a constant instead of updating to a new magic number in all three places (GetArg, help function, GUI).

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/a8d45d6cfc545827b159e14dbe47ac41dd1b2f30 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
ACK, I intend to create a constant for these settings, that are shared by GUI and core.
@jgarzik I can't speak with exact numbers, but the increase in sync speed is tangible.

ACK

Would be nice if all '100' magic numbers had an associated named constant.
